title: Hibberts Gore, Maine
text:
Hibberts Gore (also called Hibberts) is a <a href="New%20England%20town%23Gores%20and%20similar%20entities">gore</a> in <a href="Lincoln%20County%2C%20Maine">Lincoln County</a>, <a href="Maine">Maine</a>, United States. The gore's population was one as of the 2020 <a href="United%20States%20Census">United States Census</a>.
History.
Ignored by the surveyors who mapped Maine, it remained unincorporated as the rest of the state was divided into <a href="New%20England%20town%23Maine">cities</a>, <a href="New%20England%20town%23Maine">towns</a>, and <a href="New%20England%20town%23Maine">plantations</a>.
Geography.
According to the <a href="United%20States%20Census%20Bureau">United States Census Bureau</a>, Hibberts Gore has a total area of 0.752 sq mi (1.95 km2), of which 0.745 sq mi (1.93 km2) is land and 0.007 sq mi (0.02 km2), or 0.9%, is water. The water is primarily wetlands, part of <a href="Sheepscot%20Pond">Sheepscot Pond</a>, which is the headwaters of <a href="Sheepscot%20River">Sheepscot River</a>.
Demographics.
As of the <a href="2020%20United%20States%20census">Census of 2020</a>, there was 1 person, 1 household, and 0 families in Hibberts Gore.
